_header: Of them that written us tofore
Note: See 4226 for the A Text, 4227 for the B Text, and 4228 for the C Text.
_description: John Gower, Confessio Amantis, Fragments & Extracts — in eight Books and a Prologue: the longest version has about 34,000 lines

…And of Ninus king of AssireI rede how þat in his

LonUnivColl.Note:
Four leaves bearing text from the ‘Religions of the World’
                    section: Book V: 775-966, 1159-1542, and 1735-1926 (i.e., both from a single
                    quire, probably the second and middle bifolia, since the second bifolium is
                    certainly a center and there are about 48 lines per column, c. 196 per
                    folio).
